body:
### Describe the bug

The [code object cache used for tracebacks](https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/6a60479de2871e9d776fc984c4158c2e6092769b/Cython/Utility/ModuleSetupCode.c#L1618) is not thread-safe under the free-threaded build. There's a few different solutions we could go with:

1. Turn off the cache under the free-threaded build. 
2. Make the cache thread-local.
3. Make the cache thread-safe.

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

Steps to reproduce:
1. Compile CPython with debug symbols and thread sanitizer support (`./configure --with-thread-sanitizer` when building)
2. Compile the following extension module, again with thread sanitizer support (doing `CFLAGS="-fsanitize=thread" pip install .` should suffice)

   ```cython
   # cython: freethreading_compatible=True

   def tmp():
       try:
           1 / 0
       except ZeroDivisionError:
           print("error")
   ```

3. Run this helper:

   ```python
   import threading
   import tmp
   
   def f(barrier):
       barrier.wait()
       tmp.tmp()

   NUM_THREADS = 10
   barrier = threading.Barrier(NUM_THREADS)
   threads = []
   for _ in range(NUM_THREADS):
       threads.append(threading.Thread(target=f, args=(barrier,)))

   for thread in threads:
       thread.start()

   for thread in threads:
       thread.join()
   ```

It might take a few times for the data race to be triggered, but I can reproduce the following traceback pretty consistently.

<details>
<summary>TSAN traceback</summary>

```
==================
WARNING: ThreadSanitizer: data race (pid=80369)
  Read of size 8 at 0x00014aa4ca20 by thread T5:
    #0 __pyx_find_code_object tmp.c:5102 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so:arm64+0xc218)
    #1 __Pyx_AddTraceback tmp.c:5283 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so:arm64+0x4d28)
    #2 __pyx_pf_3tmp_tmp tmp.c:2259 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so:arm64+0xabb0)
    #3 __pyx_pw_3tmp_1tmp tmp.c:2185 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so:arm64+0xaa48)
    #4 __Pyx_CyFunction_Vectorcall_NOARGS tmp.c:4735 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so:arm64+0xa3d0)
    #5 _PyObject_VectorcallTstate pycore_call.h:168 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e634c)
    #6 PyObject_Vectorcall call.c:327 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e7e00)
    #7 _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault generated_cases.c.h:813 (python3.13:arm64+0x10031a2d0)
    #8 _PyEval_Vector ceval.c:1812 (python3.13:arm64+0x100314ce8)
    #9 _PyFunction_Vectorcall call.c (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e8340)
    #10 _PyObject_VectorcallTstate pycore_call.h:168 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000edc3c)
    #11 method_vectorcall classobject.c:70 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000ec178)
    #12 _PyVectorcall_Call call.c:273 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e7cb4)
    #13 _PyObject_Call call.c:348 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e7efc)
    #14 PyObject_Call call.c:373 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e8128)
    #15 thread_run _threadmodule.c:337 (python3.13:arm64+0x1004fe5a4)
    #16 pythread_wrapper thread_pthread.h:243 (python3.13:arm64+0x100445658)

  Previous write of size 8 at 0x00014aa4ca20 by thread T10:
    #0 __pyx_insert_code_object tmp.c:5123 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so:arm64+0xc8e0)
    #1 __Pyx_AddTraceback tmp.c:5297 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so:arm64+0x4e38)
    #2 __pyx_pf_3tmp_tmp tmp.c:2259 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so:arm64+0xabb0)
    #3 __pyx_pw_3tmp_1tmp tmp.c:2185 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so:arm64+0xaa48)
    #4 __Pyx_CyFunction_Vectorcall_NOARGS tmp.c:4735 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so:arm64+0xa3d0)
    #5 _PyObject_VectorcallTstate pycore_call.h:168 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e634c)
    #6 PyObject_Vectorcall call.c:327 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e7e00)
    #7 _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault generated_cases.c.h:813 (python3.13:arm64+0x10031a2d0)
    #8 _PyEval_Vector ceval.c:1812 (python3.13:arm64+0x100314ce8)
    #9 _PyFunction_Vectorcall call.c (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e8340)
    #10 _PyObject_VectorcallTstate pycore_call.h:168 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000edc3c)
    #11 method_vectorcall classobject.c:70 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000ec178)
    #12 _PyVectorcall_Call call.c:273 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e7cb4)
    #13 _PyObject_Call call.c:348 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e7efc)
    #14 PyObject_Call call.c:373 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e8128)
    #15 thread_run _threadmodule.c:337 (python3.13:arm64+0x1004fe5a4)
    #16 pythread_wrapper thread_pthread.h:243 (python3.13:arm64+0x100445658)

  Location is global '__pyx_code_cache' at 0x00014aa4ca18 (tmp.cpython-313td-darwin.so+0x14a20)

  Thread T5 (tid=6304385, running) created by main thread at:
    #0 pthread_create <null>:103815856 (libclang_rt.tsan_osx_dynamic.dylib:arm64e+0x309d8)
    #1 do_start_joinable_thread thread_pthread.h:290 (python3.13:arm64+0x1004441ac)
    #2 PyThread_start_joinable_thread thread_pthread.h:314 (python3.13:arm64+0x100443ff0)
    #3 do_start_new_thread _threadmodule.c:1849 (python3.13:arm64+0x1004fe0b8)
    #4 thread_PyThread_start_joinable_thread _threadmodule.c:1972 (python3.13:arm64+0x1004fcb98)
    #5 cfunction_call methodobject.c:540 (python3.13:arm64+0x10019bc40)
    #6 _PyObject_MakeTpCall call.c:242 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e6a4c)
    #7 _PyObject_VectorcallTstate pycore_call.h:166 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e63b4)
    #8 PyObject_Vectorcall call.c:327 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e7e00)
    #9 _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault generated_cases.c.h:1502 (python3.13:arm64+0x10031ddc4)
    #10 _PyEval_Vector ceval.c:1812 (python3.13:arm64+0x100314ce8)
    #11 PyEval_EvalCode ceval.c:602 (python3.13:arm64+0x100314950)
    #12 run_eval_code_obj pythonrun.c:1337 (python3.13:arm64+0x1004281a0)
    #13 run_mod pythonrun.c:1422 (python3.13:arm64+0x100427cd4)
    #14 _PyRun_SimpleFileObject pythonrun.c:490 (python3.13:arm64+0x10042267c)
    #15 _PyRun_AnyFileObject pythonrun.c:77 (python3.13:arm64+0x100421e9c)
    #16 Py_RunMain main.c:776 (python3.13:arm64+0x10045d624)
    #17 pymain_main main.c:806 (python3.13:arm64+0x10045e26c)
    #18 Py_BytesMain main.c:830 (python3.13:arm64+0x10045e2e8)
    #19 main python.c:15 (python3.13:arm64+0x100000dc0)

  Thread T10 (tid=6304390, running) created by main thread at:
    #0 pthread_create <null>:103813504 (libclang_rt.tsan_osx_dynamic.dylib:arm64e+0x309d8)
    #1 do_start_joinable_thread thread_pthread.h:290 (python3.13:arm64+0x1004441ac)
    #2 PyThread_start_joinable_thread thread_pthread.h:314 (python3.13:arm64+0x100443ff0)
    #3 do_start_new_thread _threadmodule.c:1849 (python3.13:arm64+0x1004fe0b8)
    #4 thread_PyThread_start_joinable_thread _threadmodule.c:1972 (python3.13:arm64+0x1004fcb98)
    #5 cfunction_call methodobject.c:540 (python3.13:arm64+0x10019bc40)
    #6 _PyObject_MakeTpCall call.c:242 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e6a4c)
    #7 _PyObject_VectorcallTstate pycore_call.h:166 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e63b4)
    #8 PyObject_Vectorcall call.c:327 (python3.13:arm64+0x1000e7e00)
    #9 _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault generated_cases.c.h:1502 (python3.13:arm64+0x10031ddc4)
    #10 _PyEval_Vector ceval.c:1812 (python3.13:arm64+0x100314ce8)
    #11 PyEval_EvalCode ceval.c:602 (python3.13:arm64+0x100314950)
    #12 run_eval_code_obj pythonrun.c:1337 (python3.13:arm64+0x1004281a0)
    #13 run_mod pythonrun.c:1422 (python3.13:arm64+0x100427cd4)
    #14 _PyRun_SimpleFileObject pythonrun.c:490 (python3.13:arm64+0x10042267c)
    #15 _PyRun_AnyFileObject pythonrun.c:77 (python3.13:arm64+0x100421e9c)
    #16 Py_RunMain main.c:776 (python3.13:arm64+0x10045d624)
    #17 pymain_main main.c:806 (python3.13:arm64+0x10045e26c)
    #18 Py_BytesMain main.c:830 (python3.13:arm64+0x10045e2e8)
    #19 main python.c:15 (python3.13:arm64+0x100000dc0)

SUMMARY: ThreadSanitizer: data race tmp.c:5102 in __pyx_find_code_object
==================
```

</details>

### Expected behaviour

No data races.

### OS

macOS

### Python version

3.13t

### Cython version

Nightly

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body:
I'll have a look later. I suspect we want to keep the cache even under free-threaded build. I think it's a reasonable time saving. 

I also think it wants to move into the module state, but that's slightly tangentially to the thread safety issue.

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.8.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.
* Support and use `am_send` for coroutines.

title: [BUG] Code object cache for tracebacks is not thread-safe
